member.name: T:Hanselman.CST352.CPU
member.summary: CPU is never instanciated, but is "always" there...like a real CPU. :) It holds and the . It also provides a mapping from s to SystemCalls in the .

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.CPU.pageSize
member.summary: The size of a memory page for this system. This should be a multiple of 4. Small sizes (like 4) will cause the system to thrash and page often. 16 is a nice compromise for such a small system. 64 might also work well. This probably won't change, but it is nice to be able to. This is loaded from Configuration on a call to

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.CPU.clock
member.summary: The clock for the system. This increments as we execute each .

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.CPU.theOS
member.summary: The CPU's reference to the . This is set by the .

member.summary: Initialized our array that represents physical memory. Should only be called once.

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.CPU.physicalMemory
member.summary: Here is the actual array of bytes that contains the physical memory for this CPU.

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.CPU.registers
member.summary: We have 10 registers. R11 is the , and we don't use R0. R10 is the . So, that's 1 to 10, and 11.

member.summary: We have a Sign Flag and a Zero Flag in a

member.name: T:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction
member.summary: Represents a single line in a program, consisting of an and one or two optional parameters. An instruction can parse a raw instruction from a test file. Tge instruction is then loaded into an which is a member of . The is translated into bytes that are loaded into the processes memory space. It's never used again, but it's a neat overly object oriented construct that simplified the coding of the creation of a and complicated the running of the whole system. It was worth it though.

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction.ToString
member.summary: Overridden method for pretty printing of Instructions
member.returns: A formatted string representing an Instruction

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction.OpCode
member.summary: The OpCode for this Instruction

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction.Param1
member.summary: The first parameter to the opCode. May be a Constant or a Register value, or not used at all

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction.Param2
member.summary: The second parameter to the opCode. May be a Constant or a Register value, or not used at all

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.Instruction.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Public constructor for an Instruction
member.param: A raw string from a Program File.
member.example:
Any one of the following lines is a valid rawInstruction
1 r1 ; incr r1 2 r6, $16 ; add 16 to r6 26 r6 ; setPriority to r6 2 r2, $5 ; increment r2 by 5 3 r1, r2 ; add 1 and 2 and the result goes in 1 2 r2, $5 ; increment r2 by 5 6 r3, $99 ; move 99 into r3 7 r4, r3 ; move r3 into r4 11 r4 ; print r4 27 ; this is exit.

member.name: T:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType
member.summary: This enum provides an easy conversion between numerical opCodes like "2" and text and easy to remember consts like "Addi"

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Noop
member.summary: No op

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Incr
member.summary:
Increments register
1 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Addi
member.summary:
Adds constant 1 to register 1
2 r1, $1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Addr
member.summary:
Adds r2 to r1 and stores the value in r1
3 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Pushr
member.summary:
Pushes contents of register 1 onto stack
4 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Pushi
member.summary:
Pushes constant 1 onto stack
5 $1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Movi
member.summary:
Moves constant 1 into register 1
6 r1, $1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Movr
member.summary:
Moves contents of register2 into register 1
7 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Movmr
member.summary:
Moves contents of memory pointed to register 2 into register 1
8 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Movrm
member.summary:
Moves contents of register 2 into memory pointed to by register 1
9 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Movmm
member.summary:
Moves contents of memory pointed to by register 2 into memory pointed to by register 1
10 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Printr
member.summary:
Prints out contents of register 1
11 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Printm
member.summary:
Prints out contents of memory pointed to by register 1
12 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Jmp
member.summary:
Control transfers to the instruction whose address is r1 bytes relative to the current instruction. r1 may be negative.
13 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Cmpi
member.summary:
Compare contents of r1 with 1. If r1 < 9 set sign flag. If r1 > 9 clear sign flag. If r1 == 9 set zero flag.
14 r1, $9

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Cmpr
member.summary:
Compare contents of r1 with r2. If r1 < r2 set sign flag. If r1 > r2 clear sign flag. If r1 == r2 set zero flag.
15 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Jlt
member.summary:
If the sign flag is set, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
16 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Jgt
member.summary:
If the sign flag is clear, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
17 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Je
member.summary:
If the zero flag is set, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
18 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Call
member.summary:
Call the procedure at offset r1 bytes from the current instrucion. The address of the next instruction to excetute after a return is pushed on the stack
19 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Callm
member.summary:
Call the procedure at offset of the bytes in memory pointed by r1 from the current instrucion. The address of the next instruction to excetute after a return is pushed on the stack
20 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Ret
member.summary:
Pop the return address from the stack and transfer control to this instruction
21

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Alloc
member.summary:
Allocate memory of the size equal to r1 bytes and return the address of the new memory in r2. If failed, r2 is cleared to 0.
22 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.AcquireLock
member.summary:
Acquire the OS lock whose # is provided in register r1. Icf the lock is not held by the current process the operation is a no-op
23 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.ReleaseLock
member.summary:
Release the OS lock whose # is provided in register r1. Another process or the idle process must be scheduled at this point. if the lock is not held by the current process, the instruction is a no-op
24 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Sleep
member.summary:
Sleep the # of clock cycles as indicated in r1. Another process or the idle process must be scheduled at this point. If the time to sleep is 0, the process sleeps infinitely
25 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.SetPriority
member.summary:
Set the priority of the current process to the value in register r1
26 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Exit
member.summary:
This opcode causes an exit and the process's memory to be unloaded. Another process or the idle process must now be scheduled
27

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.FreeMemory
member.summary:
Free the memory allocated whose address is in r1
28 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.MapSharedMem
member.summary:
Map the shared memory region identified by r1 and return the start address in r2
29 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.SignalEvent
member.summary:
Signal the event indicated by the value in register r1
30 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.WaitEvent
member.summary:
Wait for the event in register r1 to be triggered resulting in a context-switch
31 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Input
member.summary:
Read the next 32-bit value into register r1
32 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.MemoryClear
member.summary:
set the bytes starting at address r1 of length r2 to zero
33 r1, r2

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.TerminateProcess
member.summary:
Terminate the process whose id is in the register r1
34 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Popr
member.summary:
Pop the contents at the top of the stack into register r1
35 r1

member.name: F:Hanselman.CST352.InstructionType.Popm
member.summary:
Pop the contents at the top of the stack into the memory pointed to by register r1
36 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Incr
member.summary: Increments register 1 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Addi
member.summary:
Adds constant 1 to register 1
2 r1, $1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Addr
member.summary:
Adds r2 to r1 and stores the value in r1
3 r1, r2

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Cmpi
member.summary:
Compare contents of r1 with 1. If r1 < 9 set sign flag. If r1 > 9 clear sign flag. If r1 == 9 set zero flag.
14 r1, $9

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Cmpr
member.summary:
Compare contents of r1 with r2. If r1 < r2 set sign flag. If r1 > r2 clear sign flag. If r1 == r2 set zero flag.
15 r1, r2

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Call
member.summary:
Call the procedure at offset r1 bytes from the current instrucion. The address of the next instruction to excetute after a return is pushed on the stack
19 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Callm
member.summary:
Call the procedure at offset of the bytes in memory pointed by r1 from the current instrucion. The address of the next instruction to excetute after a return is pushed on the stack
20 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Ret
member.summary:
Pop the return address from the stack and transfer control to this instruction
21

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Jmp
member.summary:
Control transfers to the instruction whose address is r1 bytes relative to the current instruction. r1 may be negative.
13 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Jlt
member.summary:
If the sign flag is set, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
16 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Jgt
member.summary:
If the sign flag is clear, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
17 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Je
member.summary:
If the zero flag is set, jump to the instruction that is offset r1 bytes from the current instruction
18 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Noop
member.summary: Just that, does nothing

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Exit
member.summary:
This opcode causes an exit and the process's memory to be unloaded. Another process or the idle process must now be scheduled
27

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Movi
member.summary:
Moves constant 1 into register 1
6 r1, $1

member.summary:
Moves contents of register2 into register 1

member.summary:

member.summary:
Moves contents of register 2 into memory pointed to by register 1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Movmm
member.summary:
Moves contents of memory pointed to by register 2 into memory pointed to by register 1

member.summary:
Prints out contents of register 1
11 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Printm
member.summary:
Prints out contents of memory pointed to by register 1
12 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Input
member.summary:
Read the next 32-bit value into register r1
32 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Sleep
member.summary:
Sleep the # of clock cycles as indicated in r1. Another process or the idle process must be scheduled at this point. If the time to sleep is 0, the process sleeps infinitely
25 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.SetPriority
member.summary:
Set the priority of the current process to the value in register r1
26 r1

member.summary:

4 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Pushi
member.summary:
Pushes constant 1 onto stack

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.TerminateProcess
member.summary:
Terminate the process whose id is in the register r1
34 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Popr
member.summary:
Pop the contents at the top of the stack into register r1
35 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.MemoryClear
member.summary:
set the bytes starting at address r1 of length r2 to zero
33 r1, r2

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Popm
member.summary:
Pop the contents at the top of the stack into the memory pointed to by register r1
36 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.AcquireLock
member.summary:
Acquire the OS lock whose # is provided in register r1. Icf the lock is not held by the current process the operation is a no-op
23 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.ReleaseLock
member.summary:
Release the OS lock whose # is provided in register r1. Another process or the idle process must be scheduled at this point. if the lock is not held by the current process, the instruction is a no-op
24 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.SignalEvent
member.summary:
Signal the event indicated by the value in register r1
30 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.WaitEvent
member.summary:
Wait for the event in register r1 to be triggered resulting in a context-switch
31 r1

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.MapSharedMem
member.summary:
Map the shared memory region identified by r1 and return the start address in r2
29 r1, r2

member.name: M:Hanselman.CST352.OS.Alloc
member.summary:
Allocate memory of the size equal to r1 bytes and return the address of the new memory in r2. If failed, r2 is cleared to 0.
22 r1, r2

member.summary:
Free the memory allocated whose address is in r1
28 r1
